Package JuegoDePalabras

Class Database

java.lang.Object
JuegoDePalabras.Database
public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
The Class MySqlDbs. It works when you want to retrieve any data from a mysql database.

  • Constructor Details

    • Database

      public Database​(java.lang.String url, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Instantiates a new Database.
      Parameters:
      url - paste here your url where is stored the database with the following syntax: jdbc:mysql://url or localhost:port/database's name.
      username - the username of the database.
      password - the password established for database.

  • Method Details

    • getTableValue

      public java.lang.String getTableValue​(java.lang.String table, java.lang.String column, java.lang.String condition)
      Gets the table value.
      Parameters:
      table - the table's name.
      column - the column where is located the value.
      condition - the condition WHERE to filter data.
      Returns:
      the table value.

    • isInTable

      public boolean isInTable​(java.lang.String table, java.lang.String value, java.lang.String column)
      Checks if is in table.
      Parameters:
      table - the table's name.
      value - the value to check.
      column - the column where is located the value (optional, if you don't want to set this value, then write null).
      Returns:
      boolean.

    • updateTable

      public void updateTable​(java.lang.String table, java.lang.String value, java.lang.String conditionFilter)
      Update table.
      Parameters:
      table - the table's name.
      value - the value to change, it should follow this syntax: column 1 = value 1, column 2 = value 2, ..., column n = value n.
      conditionFilter - the condition to filter data.

    • insertValuesInTable

      public void insertValuesInTable​(java.lang.String table, java.lang.String columns, java.lang.String values)
      Insert values in table.
      Parameters:
      table - the table's name.
      columns - the columns where you'll set the values, it follow this syntax: column 1, column 2, ..., column n.
      values - the values to insert, they must follow this syntax: (value 1, value2, ..., value n), (value 1, value2, ..., value n), ..., (value 1, value2, ..., value n).

    • deleteValuesInTable

      public void deleteValuesInTable​(java.lang.String table, java.lang.String conditionFilter)
      Delete values in table.
      Parameters:
      table - the table's name.
      conditionFilter - the condition to filter data.

    • resetTableId

      public void resetTableId​(java.lang.String table)
      Reset table id.
      Parameters:
      table - the table's name.

    • killConnections

      public void killConnections()
      Releases the connection with the database.
